description:
1. Cover by Jim Mooney.
  2. Written by Mark Waid and Andrew MacLaney.
  3. Typography and production by Amber Graphics Inc.
  4. Reviewed by Ron Bialkowski, Robert Klein, Lou Mougin, Mike Tiefenbacher and John Wells.
  5. Consulted by George Olshevsky.
  • Inside Front Cover: Creator credits.
  • Pages 1-2: A history of the below characters (similar to the Who's Who series except there are no pictures of the characters just their personal symbol and their names in English and Interlac). Also included: their place of birth, the issue where their origin is told and the span of issues that they were a member of the Legion of Super-Heroes.
  • Pages 3-32: A summary of each issue to include a photo of the cover, creator credits, characters, comments and a synopsis of the Legion of Super-Heroes appearances only. Issues summarized in chronological order are: Adventure Comics #324-347.
  • Inside Back Cover: The purpose, the present and future goals of the DC Comics index series by Murray Ward.

Notes:

  • Non-Legion of Super-Heroes stories indexed only include the title, creator credits and the featured character.
  • Though the title on the cover is Illustrated Index Legion of Super-Heroes, the inside indicia states The Legion of Super-Heroes Index.
name: Issue Three

volume.name: The Official Legion of Super-Heroes Index

description:
1. Cover by Jim Mooney.
  2. Written by Mark Waid and Andrew MacLaney.
  3. Typography and production by Amber Graphics Inc.
  4. Reviewed by Ron Bialkowski, Robert Klein, Lou Mougin, Mike Tiefenbacher and John Wells.
  5. Consulted by George Olshevsky.
  • Inside Front Cover: Creator credits.
  • Pages 1-2: A history of the below characters (similar to the Who's Who series except there are no pictures of the characters just their personal symbol and their names in English and Interlac). Also included: their place of birth, the issue where their origin is told and the span of issues that they were a member of the Legion of Super-Heroes.
  • Pages 2-32: A summary of each issue to include a photo of the cover, creator credits, characters, comments and a synopsis of the Legion of Super-Heroes appearances only. Issues summarized in chronological order are: Adventure Comics #348-368, Superboy #147 and Adventure Comics #369.
  • Inside Back Cover: The purpose, the present and future goals of the DC Comics index series by Murray Ward.

Notes:

  • Non-Legion of Super-Heroes stories indexed only include the title, creator credits and the featured character.
  • Though the title on the cover is Illustrated Index Legion of Super-Heroes, the inside indicia states The Legion of Super-Heroes Index.
name: Issue Four

volume.name: The Official Legion of Super-Heroes Index

description:
1. Cover by Richard Howell.
  2. Written by Mark Waid and Andrew MacLaney.
  3. Typography and production by Amber Graphics Inc.
  4. Reviewed by Ron Bialkowski, Robert Klein, Lou Mougin, Mike Tiefenbacher and John Wells.
  5. Consulted by George Olshevsky.
  • Inside Front Cover: Creator credits.
  • Pages 1-3: A history of the below characters (similar to the Who's Who series except there are no pictures of the characters just their personal symbol and their names in English and Interlac). Also included: their place of birth, the issue where their origin is told and the span of issues that they were a member of the Legion of Super-Heroes.
  • Pages 4-32: A summary of each issue to include a photo of the cover, creator credits, characters, comments and a synopsis of the Legion of Super-Heroes appearances only. Issues summarized in chronological order are: Adventure Comics #370-380 and Action Comics #377-390.
  • Inside Back Cover: The purpose, the present and future goals of the DC Comics index series by Murray Ward.

Notes:

  • Non-Legion of Super-Heroes stories indexed only include the title, creator credits and the featured character.
  • Though the title on the cover is Illustrated Index Legion of Super-Heroes, the inside indicia states The Legion of Super-Heroes Index.
name: Issue Five

volume.name: The Official Legion of Super-Heroes Index

description:
Overview

It all comes together in this climactic issue as we follow the twisted paths of Bruce Banner and Nick Fury as they approach their destinies. And at last--the Watchers speak! And what they have to say about the uncertain future of the Ultimate Universe is utterly terrifying. You must not miss this one!

Summary

The Watchers have finally shown themselves, and they have a message. Using Susan Storm as a "microphone" they tell the Fantastic four that the end of the world is coming. That the moments leading up to this point have shown them it will happen....but they don't know how it will. Announcing that a Herald will be needed for the worlds survival and that they are deciding on who at this very moment.

What did Magneto do so many years ago that helped in creating the man we know today? The answer lies with one single death.

Nick Fury and Duncan Dugan find the truth behind Weapon X, an if the truth is allowed to be heard by the world it could spell devastation for all humans. What will the two of them do, How will they keep this horrible secret hidden. And who is the new Herald for Earth, the answer is unexpected.
name: Part 5

description: Badger, that ‘80s stalwart, is back to do more than just save comics like he did last month… this time, he’s here to save the entire world. In the first issue of an all-new, five-part Badger adventure written by creator Mike Baron, Badger finds himself up against amazing odds that take him from a small-town jail cell to, well, you’ll have to see it to believe it, Larry.

In the second issue of Mike Baron’s all-new Badger miniseries, "Dog Killer," a crazed killer uses dogs to attack America's cities. Only the Badger can stop Pavlov's reign of terror. But there is far more to Pavlov than homicidal hatred, as the duel between him and Badger turns intensely personal. Plus, what’s up with Ham? The adventure of a lifetime begins here.

In the third chapter of Mike Baron’s all-new Badger miniseries, “The Mercy Tax,” where once Ham’s castle stood is a smoking ruin. Daisy clings desperately to life, her self-confidence destroyed. And in the African veldt, Badger has a confrontation with his totem that changes everything forever. Everything you thought you knew about the Badger was wrong! Plus, Pavlov’s plot reaches fruition with the appearance of the greatest martial artist of all time, and no, it’s not Count Dante.

Where once Ham's castle stood is now a smoking ruin. Daisy clings desperately to life, her self-confidence destroyed. In the African veldt, Badger has a confrontation with his totem that changes everything forever. Whatever you thought you knew about the Badger was wrong! Meanwhile, Pavlov's plot reaches fruition with the appearance of the greatest martial artist of all time-and no, it's not Count Dante.

In “The Big Finish,” terrorists take over the Oscars and threaten to kill America’s beloved celebrities, beginning with Chastity Slut. Into this cluster foxtrot drop Badger and the Little Dragon, fresh off the veldt and primed for combat. The ending will bring not only greater understanding and harmony among the indigenous peoples of the world, but it will materially improve your own lives.
name: The Big Finish

description:
Overview

The smash European series Chicanos arrives on these shores with this first issue of an ongoing series recounting the misadventures of A.Y. Jalisco, Private Detective. Penned by Carlos Trillo and featuring art by fan favorite Eduardo Risso (100 Bullets), Chicanos follows Jalisco, an unattractive, short Mexican woman who follows her dream of becoming a private eye in the U.S. while trying to stay one step ahead of the bad luck which inevitably follows her. Gripping, compelling action!

Overview

The smash European series Chicanos continues! Hard luck detective A.Y. Jalisco recalls her Mexican childhood and the discovery of her private-eye prowess in a case with far-reaching effects on her own family. Meanwhile, her current life in the big city is no walk in the park, either, as her best friend Marita meets a glamorous policewoman that further erodes Jalisco’s self-esteem.

Overview

In this issue, the unlikely detective A.Y. Jalisco takes a night-shift job at an Asian laundromat, only to make a shocking discovery about the identity of the thief that’s been robbing it. Then, her luck seems to change when she gets a call from a rich benefactor, but instead of a big payday she experiences the worst day ever!

Overview

A.Y. Jalisco, lonely for too long, decides to change her love life for the better. But her plans are ruined by the gender-shifted Guadalupe, who puts Jalisco’s life in danger while seducing her man. Her bad luck continues when she’s attacked by a hulking brute looking for information on a man she doesn’t even know!

Overview

When it comes to luck, Mexican-born detective A.Y. Jalisco has a lot of it… all bad. Then Mel, a handsome and mysterious stranger, appears out of the blue and sweeps her off her feet. But the ugly realities of her professional life intrude when she must rescue a client from armed thugs… and lose her new love in the process.

1. Cover by Chuck Patton and Al Gordon.
  2. Typographer and production by Tony Frutti.
  3. Proofreading by Laura (Webb) Ward.
  4. Reviewed by Chuck Huber, Lou Mougin and Mike Tiefenbacher.
  5. Consultants by Jerry Bails, Dennis Mallonee, George Olshevsky and Gene Reed.
  6. Approved by the Staff of DC Comics.
name: Issue One

description:
1. Cover by Chuck Patton and Thomas Yeates.
  2. Typographer and production by Tony Frutti.
  3. Proofreader and research assistant by Laura (Webb) Ward.
  4. Reviewed by Chuck Huber, Lou Mougin and Mike Tiefenbacher.
  5. Consultants by Jerry Bails, Dennis Mallonee, George Olshevsky and Gene Reed.
  6. Approved by the Staff of DC Comics.
name: Issue Two

description:
1. Cover by Chuck Patton and Thomas Yeates.
  2. Typographer and production by Tony Frutti.

  4. Reviewed by Chuck Huber, Lou Mougin and Mike Tiefenbacher.
  5. Consultants by Jerry Bails, Dennis Mallonee, George Olshevsky and Gene Reed.
  6. Approved by the Staff of DC Comics.
name: Issue Three

  2. Typographer and production by Tony Frutti.
  3. Reviewed by Chuck Huber, Lou Mougin and Mike Tiefenbacher.
  4. Consultants by Jerry Bails, Dennis Mallonee, George Olshevsky and Gene Reed.
  5. Approved by the Staff of DC Comics.
name: Issue Four

description:
1. Cover by Chuck Patton and Al Gordon.
  2. Typographer and production by Tony Frutti.
  3. Reviewed by Chuck Huber, Lou Mougin and Mike Tiefenbacher.
  4. Consultants by Jerry Bails, Dennis Mallonee, George Olshevsky and Gene Reed.
  5. Approved by the Staff of DC Comics.
name: Issue Five

description: For 12-year-old Anda, getting paid real money to kill the characters of players who were cheating in her favorite online computer game was a win-win situation. Until she found out who was paying her, and what those characters meant to the livelihood of children around the world.
name: Anda's Game

volume.name: Cory Doctorow's Futuristic Tales of the Here and Now

description: IDW Publishing continues to bring the stories of acclaimed science-fiction author Cory Doctorow to comics, this time offering up "Nimby and the D-Hoppers." Night after night, the peaceful serenity of a non-technocratic society is shattered by the chaotic and disruptive arrival of fully automatic, laser-guided, armor-piercing, self-replenishing personal sidearm wielding dimension hoppers. Well, for the once-involved couple of Barry and Sally—enough is enough. With a cover by Ben Templesmith (30 Days of Night)!
name: Nimby and the D-Hoppers

volume.name: Cory Doctorow's Futuristic Tales of the Here and Now

description: CVO, the top-secret CIA covert ops squad of Vampire agents, returns at last! The squad has finally been reinstated as America’s first line of supernatural defense. They’ve been tasked with tracking down the source of magic artifacts used to spread terror, but along the way, Cross must face his past as a member of Delta Force... and the partner he left behind.

volume.name: CVO: Covert Vampiric Operations - African Blood

description: The CVO team is infiltrated in the mountains of Ethiopia, during their search for a smuggler of magic and artillica artifacts. Cross, Britt, Bools, and Kraft are high-tech, vampire covert ops... but the Horn of Africa could be the most hostile land in the Earth, and the African Azde vampires just might be too strong for them...

volume.name: CVO: Covert Vampiric Operations - African Blood

description: Debelo, the druglord and smuggler, have captured or killed the CVO team. He's going to use Britt to nurse a new breed of Azde vampires, he's torturing Cross, using his former friend Noble, now an Azde vampire, and Bools is MIA. Everything is lost and the CIA have no option but to order an air raid on Debelo's quarters... which means the death of the CVO team!

volume.name: CVO: Covert Vampiric Operations - African Blood

description: The CVO finally captured Debelo and dismantled his plans... except one—his final torture and revenge on Cross. His friend Noble, now an Azde vampire, will kill Cross's wife and son. A family that the government kept hiden from Cross's eyes to make him the most deadly vampire operative. Now Cross must save his family... and the CIA have their own plans about that.

volume.name: CVO: Covert Vampiric Operations - African Blood

description: Haunted by horrible nightmares, Harlan Draka wanders the countryside, shamelessly making money pretending to be a Dampyr- half human/half vampire- ridding villages of what they naively believe are evil vampires. But when he is summoned by soldiers who are under attack by real vampires, Harlan learns the horrible truth: his nightmares are reality!
name: Devil's Son

description: After their near-fatal encounter with Gorka, the powerful master of the night, the unlikely trio of half human/half-vampire Harlan Draka, the beautiful vampire Tesla, and tough warrior Kurjak prepare to face him once more. Visions sent to Draka draw the trio ever closer to their foe, and this time it is a bloody, horrifying fight to the death where only one can survive...
name: Night Tribe

description: When a father and son on their way to a Cornish village go missing, the new "stranger" in town, Harlan Draka, becomes the number one suspect. Unwittingly drawn into this mystery, Harlan meets the beautiful Amber - who knew Harlan's father and just so happens to be a vampire herself! Together they seek out the monster that has been terrorizing the helpless village for so long.
name: Sand Specters

description: Harlan Draka continues his quest to rid the world of evil vampires and unlock the dark secrets of his mysterious past. This time out, Harlan, the "good" vampire Tesla, and the fiercely loyal soldier Kurjak find themselves doing business with vicious Russian Mafia. But this is only a ruse for Harlan to track down the Vurdalak, the Lord of Lost Souls. Having committed the worst atrocities imaginable, Vurdalak proves to be Harlan's most dangerous adversary so far.
name: Nocturne In Red

description: In his most bizarre adventure yet, Harlan Draka is summoned - alone - by a mysterious message to Kampa Island. As he seeks out his summoner, Caleb Lost, and his hard-to-find "Theatre of Lost Steps," Harlan encounters Nickolaus, a likeable but not very trustworthy adversary who leads Harlan in circles. Unsure what is real and what is illusion on this frightening, ghost-filled island, Harlan finds himself a pawn in the plan to resurrect the most horrible creature in all of legend - the Golem!
name: Under The Stone Bridge

description: Hell in Berlin! Tesla, the she-vampire fighting with Harlan Draka against the Masters of Darkness, comes face-to-face with two pieces of her past from the dark heart of the German capital. The mysterious Lamiah, freed from her century-long detention, fights against her greatest enemy, Shrek, in the Underworld. Now the Dampyr must make a choice: which of the two will be his opponent and which will be his ally in this bloody struggle?
name: Lamiah

description: Pretending to be a Professor of Vampirism, Harlan Draka investigates the mysterious and brutal deaths of several female college students. Certain that the killer is a master of the night, Harlan must figure out exactly who he is before the monster finds the spell book from the darkness, an ancient book of magic that grants power beyond imagination. But when the bloody bodies start piling up, Harlan realizes he may be too late.
name: From The Darkness

description: Harlan Draka travels to Africa, where the South African Himba tribe revere the undead. With the help of Mujaive, a clairvoyant, our three vampire slayers - Draka, Tesla, and Kurjak - get involved in a no-holds-barred war in the diamond lands of Namibia. On the track of Omulu, the monstrous god of the plague, the dampyr finds himself besieged in the ghost town of Brandenmund by the lost legion of cruel Jan Vathek... will this be the end of the road for Harlan?
name: Skeleton Coast

description: IDW Publishing continues its re-presentation of classic Doctor Who comics from across time and space as “The Star Beast” concludes, giving way to… “The Dogs of Doom!” Storytelling courtesy of writers Pat Mills & John Wagner, and stunning newly recolored art by Watchmen’s Dave Gibbons. Artist Joe Corroney (Star Trek: Klingons) provides an all-new cover recreating a scene from the classic comics.
name: Doctor Who and the Star Beast

description: This time around, the good (fourth) Doctor runs afoul of the “Dragon’s Claw.” By Steve Moore, John Wagner, Pat Mills, and Dave Gibbons (Watchmen), with all-new colors over Gibbons’ classic art by Charlie Kirchoff, who also re-creates the original Gibbons cover for this issue, too.
name: Doctor Who And The Dragon's Claw

description: This time around, the good (Fourth) Doctor concludes his adventure with “The Collector,” and is beset by the “Dreamers of Death.” Written by Steve Moore and featuring Dave Gibbons’s classic linework, with all-new colors over Gibbons’ art by Charlie Kirchoff, who also re-creates the original Gibbons cover for this issue, too.
name: The Collector; Dreamers of Death

description:
Bagged, reprints 6 different Valiant comics
Tradepaperback/reprint info: Reprints Magnus 12, Solar 10-11, Eternal Warrior 4-5, Shadowman 8.
Contains The Valiant Era: Companion
name: Trade Paperback

description: Was included (bagged) with the Valiant Era Trade Paperback.
name: featuring Eternal Warrior

description:
Overview:

Before the Skrulls invaded the human race, they battled the noble Kree in a bloodwar that has lasted centuries. And in this special Secret Invasion tie-in, the lives of two of the most famous Kree, Captain Mar-Vell and Marvel Boy, will alter the events of the Invasion forever. This special issue will have very serious consequences for the future of Mighty Avengers.

Homage to Avengers vol.1 issue 89
name: [untitled]

description: The human survivors are facing the last minutes of freedom as the Skrull victory seems to be inminent. But Ben Urich, reporter of the Front Line, will have the unique chance to witness the last stand of the human heroes against the Skrull armada.
name: Chapter Four: The Fall of Manhattan

description: Raven is missing, and the Titans must truly come together as a team in order to save her. Their fragile unity is further threatened, though, when they discover what they're really up against! And, as if the Titans didn't have enough on their hands, an old member resurfaces and brings along an unexpected threat that no one could've seen coming!
name: Together. Together Forever

description: Rasl's world is closing in around him and the only way to regain control is to leave it! The multi-dimensional art thief returns to the parallel universe where Dylan isn't Dylan, where he makes some startling discoveries - about his past, and the nature of reality itself! Then, meet the beautiful and mysterious Maya, whose name is tattooed on Rasl's arm. Also, after a number of bloody encounters, Rasl confronts his would-be assassin and learns the reason the lizard-faced man is hunting him across multiple universes!
name: Maya

description:
Free Tom and Jerry comic when you buy selected  "Tom and Jerry War of the Whiskers" games (make sure it has that "Free Tom and Jerry Collectable DC Comic Book Inside!" box in the upper left hand corner).

I couldn't find a scan for the comic book proper, but it looks exactly as shown, except the video game company, ESRB rating, and "Free ... comic book inside!" are removed, and a blue box, under the word "whiskers" is there saying "Presents: a special free collector's edition comic!"

In the comic, Tom finds a dog suit and starts creating havoc.
name: Clothes Make the Dog!

volume.name: Tom and Jerry in War of the Whiskers Presents a Special Free Collector's Edition Comic

description:
Dynamite continues to present the most the most savage stories that comic creators have ever told! Each issue of the bi-monthly Savage Tales will feature a rotating cast of characters and creators featuring the savage and brutal worlds of Red Sonja, Thulsa Doom and more!

Issue #6 Features:

Hercules: The Unnamed Task (Part 1) By Doug Murray and Fabiano Neves; History tells us of the 12 Tasks of Hercules, but writer Doug Murray and artist Fabiano Neves tell us of the very first, untold task of the legendary demi-god!

Thulsa Doom: Age of Doom (Part 2) By Luke Lieberman and Noah Salonga; continuing the explosive origin of Red Sonja villain Thulsa Doom!

Sellsword Part Three (Conclusion) By Doug Murray and Diego Bernard; the conclusion of our tale featuring the lone swordsman and his battle with two rival families!

The Ripper Part Three (Conclusion) By Mike Raicht and Pere Perez! The Ripper stands revealed! All while leaving a fresh trail of bloody corpses!

All the action and excitement (and sex and violence) under two "savage" covers, one by Arthur Suydam and the other from artist Fabiano Neves
name: Pillars of Hercules Part One / Sellsword Part Three / The Ripper Part Three / Thulsa Doom: The Serpent's Den Part Two

description: It's Science Fair time at Springfield Elementary, and Lisa sets out to win the top prize. Her daring experiment into the genetic similarities between the members of the Simpson family blows up in her face when she discovers that one member of her immediate family is not a blood relative. You'll never guess who it is! Meanwhile, Bart and Milhouse stage their own experiment in sleep deprivation, which results in a lot of other things blowing up! Sign up with the Simpsons in October!
name: DNAin't Necessarily So

description: Over the course of her life, STORM has been many things: A thief. A goddess. An X-Man. A Wife. A Queen. But not until now have these roles come into conflict. When a mutant commits a mysterious murder in Wakanda, Storm takes it upon herself to investigate. And what she discovers will force her into a position where she must choose: Will she stand with the X-Men or with her husband? Writer Chris Yost (X-FORCE, NEW X-MEN) and up-and-coming artist Diogenes Neves bring you this first part of a limited series that will change Storm forever...
name: Part One

description:
James Rhodes has the power of an entire army at his disposal. He's the War Machine and maybe the last bastion of human hope against the Skrull Armada. Too bad for Rhodey, he's always been a weapon and is not used to take critical decisions on the battlefield, and his decision to aid the Russian Winter Guard, may be a mistake he'll regret for what's left of his life.

After kicking some alien tail in space. Rhodey follows a Skrull ship that escaped the initial barrage from his Mega War Machine and takes it down. But as he bounces around through orbit he goes off course and lands in Russia. Where the Winter Guard are in the process of loosing, the skrulls are after their nuclear arsenals. Finding that he cant stand by and watch them be slaughtered.

But Dynamo sees his interference as something not needed, and when the Winter Guard are out numbered an retreat they leave War Machine behind in the middle of a Skrull ambush. And Soon War Machine is captured an wakes up...on the operating table.
name: War Machine: Weapon of S.H.I.E.L.D. Part 2

description: A new breed of heroes is born when five teenaged friends create holographic forcefields which allow them to duplicate the powers of the animal kingdom. These high- tech heroes are the WILDSIDERZ, and this is the action-packed issue where the fun begins!  This low-priced special, $1.99 for 32 pages, introduces the entire WILDSIDERZ cast in their own fully illustrated bio pages. Join Campbell and Wildsiderz co-creator Andy Hartnell as they take you inside the studio. From exclusive concept sketches to an in-depth interview with the creators, you'll learn all the secrets behind their latest creation. But this extra-special issue is much more than that, with all-new, full-color, cover- to-cover artwork created for this book, including a Hollywood-style first look at the ongoing series in an 8-page preview story that's exclusive to this issue!
name: It Begins Here!

deck: Disney's Aladdin (1992) comes to Marvel Comics in an all-new all-ages series!
description:
It's all-new adventures for Aladdin, Genie, Abu, Iago and Princess Jasmine on the Magic Carpet in Agrabah!

The Sultan of Agrabah sends Aladdin on a quest to accomplish three things: carry the world on his shoulders in a show of strength; discover what is known to no one else I the Fire Desert as a show of intelligence; and in a show of courage; find the mythical Morning Bird!
name: Aladdin's Quest

description: Tireless foes of Chaos in the Warhammer universe, Witch Hunters roam the Empire seeking to stop the spread of dark magic and witchery of all kinds. When Witch Hunter Magnus Gault hears that the nearby village of Loughville has fallen prey to the canker of Chaos, he is driven to investigate. Once there, he finds the buildings rancid and rotted and the villagers wretched and mutated - eager to prey upon any lost soul who should come their way. Can one man stand against this monstrous regiment?
name: Chapter I

description:
Overview

Having single-handedly put the Chaos-corrupted inhabitants of Loughville to the sword and flame, Witch Hunter Magnus Gault backtracks along the tainted river to find the source of the corruption. Gault's quest ends at the village of Mittlesedorf, which he finds miraculously untouched. However, there is a worm in the rotten-apple, and even Gault may not be a match for the foes that await him!
name: Chapter II

description:
Overview

Armed with only steel, shot, fire, and faith, Witch Hunter Magnus Gault joins forces with Great Sword Vogel (from WARHAMMER: FORGE OF WAR) as the two men-at-arms face down the pustulated inhabitants of Mittleresdorf - who just happen to all be Chaos afflicted followers of Nurgle!
name: Chapter III

description:
Overview

Now joined on his quest by Great Sword Vogel, Witch Hunter Magnus Gault traces the source of the Chaos contamination to a battlefield that saw one of the Empire's greatest defeats. Venturing inside the labyrinthine Skaven-infested caverns, Gault and Vogel join forces with Vargni the dwarf (from WARHAMMER: FORGE OF WAR) and together they uncover the origin of the corruption that has been plaguing the land.
name: Chapter IV

description:
Overview

Witch Hunter Magnus Gault, Great Sword Vogel, and Vargni the Dwarf all unite in a final, desperate pitched battle against the Skaven horde that attempts to destroy the giant Warpstone that has been corrupting and contaminating the land. With the odds and weight of numbers stacked heavily against Gault, Vogel, and Vargni, the only certainty is that they'll go down fighting!
name: Chapter V

description:
Overview

The heist continues! Two thieves who are anything but what they seem prepare to pull off a big score – but is their target what it seems? The fallout starts! When's the other shoe going to drop? And what does it have to do with the C.I.A.? Trust us when we say that the twistiest, smartest, most clever story of the year continues here in the vein of Ocean's Eleven and The Italian Job! Twist on top of twist on top of twist, for fans of Ed Brubaker's Criminal!

Overview

Things start to get interesting as enemies become friends. Trench finds that he's got no allies, as his superiors show their true colors and the world of undercover cops and intelligence operatives proves to be just as tricky as the underworld. Who can he trust? And are the people he trusts the least his only allies?

Overview

Everything comes unraveled. Trench and Steadman find when everyone wants you dead, your only ally has got to become your enemy! Teaming up, they angle to take down the conspiracy that threatens to wipe them out. A fun crime fiction romp in the vein of Ocean's Eleven and The Italian Job!

Overview

The greatest heist comic of the year concludes with all things unraveling. Trench and Steadman find that when everyone wants you dead, allies become enemies and enemies become allies! Teaming up, they angle to take down the conspiracy that threatens to wipe them out.

Overview

The mob's going to war with super-villain organization S.L.A.S.H. while the mysterious super-villain known as The Black Plague goes to war with them both. It's a look into the criminal underworld in a super-powered reality as various factions battle for power.

Alex has gone from out-of-work actor to overnight sensation.  Now he's dealing with the pros and cons of his newfound celebrity, he can't take his most essential asset – the new bodyguard dedicated to protecting him!  They fight like cats and dogs, meanwhile the  questions keep piling up as no one knows why someone wants him dead.
name: It Never Rains In Los Angeles

description: You're an out-of-work L.A. actor. Your agent won't take your calls. You see an accident on Mulholland and decide to help out. The next thing you know, thugs are trying to murder you! But on the plus side, you've become the biggest, hottest actor in L.A. overnight! And your bodyguard's pretty hot - too bad she hates you!
name: ... And This Time, It's Peronsal

description: The bullets are flying, as everyone's favorite action hero finds that his bodyguard is the only one who can save him from an unseen enemy. Can he tolerate the scathing sarcastic wit of his cover girl long enough to get down to the bottom of who wants him dead?
name: L. A. Confidential

description: Everyone's favorite action hero and his cover girl reach their conclusion - this unlikely duo forges an alliance - or a romance? - and face off against the forces that are looking to lay them down.
name: That's A Wrap, People!
The Beach; Witch Hunter; Quality Time; Cthulhu Calls; The Oddly Amourous Phineas Flynn and the Troublesome Trouble He Got Himself In

description:
From the horrific to the silly, Cthulhu Tales takes H.P. Lovecraft's style of storytelling - and often many of his familiar icons - and runs with them. At its most intense, it tells harrowing tales of horror filled with insanity, in keeping with Lovecraft's original works. At its most envelope-pushing, this anthology tells extremely silly stories that take characters like Cthulhu and run with them. A fun, wild, inventive, and often scary anthology horror series, Cthulhu Tales takes the familiar literary tradition of the Lovecraft-influenced short story and introduces it to comics.

  • The Eyes of Madness by Steve Niles
  • The Farm by Michael Alan Nelson
  • Exactly The Right Word by Tom Peyer
name: The Eyes Of Madness

description:
Cthulhu Calls and Steve Niles answers! Niles, Eric Calderon and Christine Boylan are aboard the new monthly series that readers demanded, based on the fan-favorite, critically-acclaimed anthology! Yes, Cthulhu Tales is back -- and this time it's monthly! More great Cthulhu stories from more great writers and artists! It's time to heed the call!

  • The Hiding Place by Steve Niles
  • Katrina by Eric Calderon
  • How To Get Ahead In The Occult by Christine Boylan
name: The Hiding Place

description:
Acclaimed writer William Messner-Loebs (JOURNEY) joins the BOOM! family! Don't tell the Elder Gods, or they'll take him from us! Messner-Loebs and Michael Alan (FALL OF CTHULHU) Nelson chill the blood in the new, monthly anthology series! Something big is happening in the BOOM! horror universe in 2008...and it starts here! Heed the call of Cthulhu!

  • Alimentary, My Dear Cthulhu by William Messner-Loebs
  • On The Wagon by Michael Alan Nelson
  • The Cruise of Cthulhu by Todd Lepre
name: Alimentary, My Dear Cthulhu

description:
Overview

The fight for life, as well as a little sanity, begins in earnest as what's left of the inmate population runs for their lives. Ray and some of the survivors, however, refuse to simply be hunted and go on the offensive.

Plus, the big question is finally answered: Just what do Werewolves taste like?

In the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina, the outpouring of human misery has drawn demons like sharks to a bloodbath. What better time for The Son of Satan -- to pay a visit?

After having a vivid dream of Demons tearing apart a hawk Hellstorm comes to New Orleans to investigate what it means. At a bar he encounters a doctor who tells him about a woman who went into labor and vanished from the hospital; the same woman the doctor ran into two weeks later with her child looking five years old. After hearing this Daimon believes his dream and the woman are connected.
name: Equinox Part 1

description: For Daimon Hellstorm, this means one thing: It's hunting season. Like Sun Tzu said, "Some battles can be won without firing a single arrow. All you need to do is sow chaos." And who better to do that than the Son of Satan?
name: Equinox Part 2

description: With otherworldly figures breathing down his neck, the key to Daimon Hellstorm's survival sits shriveled in a little glass jar, waiting to be reunited with its host. All the Son of Satan needs is needle and thread, and to take the biggest gamble of his life. God help us if he rolls craps.
name: Equinox Part 4

description: It all comes down to this. Trapped between Hell and a hot place, Daimon Hellstorm unveils his trap -- and teaches his old man a thing or two in the process.
name: Equinox Part 5

description:
Pick up the adventures of Earth's Mightiest Heroes from day one with the Marvel Masterworks! Comicdom's greatest assemblage of super heroes burst onto the scene in 1963 as Marvel Comics revolutionized the comic-adventure art form. Gathering together to face the evil Loki, Iron Man, the Incredible Hulk, Ant-Man, the Wasp, and the Mighty Thor formed the improbable core of the ever-changing super-team. But it was three issues later when, from the ice of the northern Atlantic, Captain America returned from the frozen depths that the Avengers truly took form. Illustrated by Jack Kirby and Don Heck, and written by Stan "The Man" Lee, you'll find the first appearances of Kang the Conqueror, Wonder Man, the Space Phantom and Baron Zemo, the debut of the Masters of Evil and the Hulk's departure from the team, and subsequent battle with the Sub-Mariner vs. the Avengers. They're Marvel Masterworks one and all!

Collects THE AVENGERS #1 - 10

NOTES:

The marbled variant cover edition is #4 in the chronological numbering.

Regular Edition ISBN: 0-7851-0883-1

Variant Edition ISBN: 0-7851-1311-8

This is the "ReMasterworks" second edition. It is slightly different from the first Masterworks edition.

REMASTERED CHANGES: The Captain America pinup from The Avengers #10 (previously seen in Marvel Masterworks: Captain America) moves to its correct placement in this volume.
name: Volume One

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description:
The Avengers say goodbye to some original members and welcome their first new recruits, including Quicksilver, the Scarlet Witch and Hawkeye. Featuring the death of Baron Zemo, a battle with Kang, and appearances by Spider-Man, the Mole Man, and the Swordsman.

Collects THE AVENGERS #11 - 20

NOTES:

The marbled variant cover edition is #9 in the chronological numbering.

Regular Edition ISBN: 978-0-7851-3202-8

Variant Edition ISBN: 978-0-7851-3203-5

This is the "ReMasterworks" second edition. It is slightly different from the first Masterworks edition.

REMASTERED CHANGES: Previously unreprinted Kang pinup from The Avengers #11 added. The comic book cover art on the dustjacket is changed from The Avengers #11 to The Avengers #12.
name: Volume Two

description:
Giant-Man becomes Goliath! The Wasp returns! The team battles the Enchantress, Power Man, the Ringmaster, Kang, Doctor Doom, Attuma, the Collector, the Swordsman, and the Black Widow! Collects THE AVENGERS #21 - 30

NOTES:

The marbled variant cover edition is #27 in the chronological numbering.

Regular Edition ISBN: 0-7851-1179-4

Variant Edition ISBN: 0-7851-1293-6

This is the "ReMasterworks" second edition. It is slightly different from the first Masterworks edition.

REMASTERED CHANGES: The comic book cover art on the dustjacket is changed from The Avengers #21 to The Avengers #23.
name: Volume Three

description:
Overview

As the ’50s dawned and the Atlas Era was born, the day of the Nazi-stomping super hero had passed, and in its place came a new style of hero reflective of the changing times. Heroes born of bizarre atomic science that battled otherworldly alien menaces, and patriotic poster boys that battled back the Communist hordes. Marvel Boy: Rejecting the tyranny of Earth’s governments, scientist Dr. Matthew Grayson built an experimental spacecraft and traveled to the planet Uranus with his infant son, Robert. In this incredible environment, young Robert developed marvelous powers of telepathy and superhuman strength, combined with a pair of amazing photonic wristbands. These astonishing powers made him Marvel Boy, cosmic protector of the solar system! The Hero Revival: The year was 1953, and with fear of Communism clutching the nation’s attention, Atlas Comics publisher Martin Goodman tapped Stan Lee – along with artists John Romita, Bill Everett, Carl Burgos and Russ Heath – to stage a revival of the most-famous super heroes of the era. Bursting onto the pages of YOUNG MEN, the Human Torch, Captain America and the Sub-Mariner made their explosive return to the comics scene! The inaugural volume of a line collecting the exceptionally rare 1950s appearances of Captain America, the Human Torch, the Sub-Mariner, Marvel Boy, the Black Knight and more, ATLAS ERA HEROES VOL. 1 is just the first peek into a historical bridge between the Golden Age and the Marvel Age of Heroes no fan should be without!
name: Volume One

description:
Overview

The Atlas Era Hero Revival continues with the adventures of the comics' most famous trio of Communist conquering heroes: Captain America, the Human Torch and the Sub-Mariner! Beginning with the Big Three's anthology adventures in Men's Adventures, we then dive headlong into Captain America's complete 1954 solo series. Illustrated by Bullpen legend John Romita in some of his very first super hero stories, you'll see Cap and Bucky fight Fifth Columnists, Commie spies and even the Soviet Electro! Next up, it's the Human Torch and Toro! Returned from his slumber by an atomic bomb, the Torch has rejoined his young sidekick in a battle to clean up threats as amazing and entertaining as vampires, killer robots and his 1950s nemesis, the Vulture. Their crime-fighting adventures even take on a global purchase, stretching all the way to the 38th Parallel and Communist Korea! And finally, for a quick taste of what's to come in Atlas Era Heroes' next volume, comes an assortment of Bill Everett's lavishly drawn tales of the lord of the Atlantis, Namor the Sub-Mariner. Considered by many to be the definitive take on the character, Everett's '50s Sub-Mariner is nothing less than treasure from the deep! We'd be remiss to leave you without a bevy of historical bonuses, including a rare Human Torch tale that went unprinted for more than a decade, original artwork, Atlas Era house ads and an introduction by Hero Revival scholar extraordinaire Roy Thomas.
name: Volume Two

description:
Overview

The Atlas Era Heroes hits the high-water mark of the 1954 revival with the sovereign of the seven seas, the Sub-Mariner! Collected for the first time ever, the Atlas SUB-MARINER series showcases Bill Everett’s most lavish, most manic and most exciting interpretation of his undersea creation. Supported by Namora, Princess Fen and intrepid love interest Betty Dean, Namor faces off against the nefarious Prince Byrrah, his own doppelganger, giant crocodiles and Communists a-plenty in issue after issue of pre-Code action and marine adventure. From all-out invasions of the surface world to the perils of exile from Atlantis, these pages define the Sub-Mariner in a way never before, and perhaps never since, captured in any comic series! Along with Dick Ayer’s Human Torch and backup stories featuring the terrors of the deep, you’ll also be treated to Everett’s tales of the young Namor and how he came to be the hot-headed protector the kingdom beneath the Antarctic ice.
name: Volume Three

description:
IT'S A MASH! IT'S A MONSTER MASH!

Marvel Masterworks have brought you classic stories from Marvel's Silver Age super hero heyday and the start of it all with its Golden Age. Now thrill to the first offering of Marvel's Atlas Era! Before the dawn of the Marvel Age, the comics world sat astride the shoulders of Atlas Comics – a world full of gun-fighting outlaws, romantic heartbreak, death-defying heroism in battle, terrifying depths of horror, and visionary science fiction. In TALES TO ASTONISH return to the days when atomic monsters roamed the Earth and alien invasions were a daily occurrence. Marvel's classic creators will make you quake at the sight of the 9th Wonder of the World! You'll tremble before the Things on Easter Island! Beware the might of Mummex - King of the Mummies! Flee before the Giant from Outer Space! Dare defy the Floating Head! Prepare to be Astonished! Collects TALES TO ASTONISH #1-10 (1959-1960).

Collecting TALES TO ASTONISH #1-10
name: Volume One

volume.name: Marvel Masterworks: Atlas Era Tales To Astonish

description:
MORE MONSTROUS MAYHEM!

Ready your fallout shelter, check your 4th dimensional passport, and get ready for a trip into the wild and wooly days of the Atlas Era! The Marvel Masterworks have prepared another heaping helping of towering terrors that eat atom bombs for breakfast and psychological mind-benders of scintillating suspense.

Lead by Jack "The King" Kirby, there’s a whole passel of monsters from beyond the edge of imagination eager to smash their way into your town. From swamp beasts, terrorizing trees, atomic ants, and Gorgilla, the gorilla who’d give King Kong a run for his money - if collateral damage is what your desire then Groot, Krang, The Blip, Rommbu, Thorr and X, The Thing That Lived, are your best friends and your insurance agent’s worst nightmare.

While Kirby tested the tensile strength of newsprint, Steve Ditko challenged readers to look through the pages of comic books and into new dimensions. His parables of suspense and wrenching psychological tension will leave you curled up and screaming for more - whether you like it or not!

Collecting TALES TO ASTONISH #11-20
name: Volume Two

volume.name: Marvel Masterworks: Atlas Era Tales To Astonish

description:
Overview

 Prepare yourself for a haunted Halloween full of pre-Code horror courtesy of the Marvel Masterworks' Atlas Era! We're turning the clock back to 1951, the time when horror reined supreme in comics. These never-before-collected stories of ghosts, ghouls, monsters, morgues, vampires, and more than a few terrors-that-dare-not-speak-their-names aren't just some of the most frightening tales ever published, they're also by a frightening array of star comic-book talents! See why Gene Colan says "He Wished He Was a Vampire"! Look out when Bill Everett gives "The Evil Eye"! Come along as Russ Heath finds a planet that may - or may not - be "Uninhabited"! Prove to Bernie Krigstein if you were "The Boy Who Was Afraid," and to stand in shock and amazement at the bevy of stories lurking just around the corner by Stan Lee's right-hand man of the '50s, comics great Joe Maneely!
name: Volume One

volume.name: Marvel Masterworks: Atlas Era Strange Tales

description:
Overview:
Scratch Fury decides to take a new angle on world domination: kill them with cuteness. Can this cat enslave the entire human race with a cute cat calendar?
Flash learns that nothing is safe anymore as Queen Bee causes an attack on his house and Linda. Guest-starring Black Lightning!
name: This Was Your Life Wally West: Invasion Part Two

description: Blythe has traveled across the globe in search of the man she loves – a man who also might be a terrorist. Now, she's a prisoner in Narimar, a country that doesn't exist on any maps, and to survive, she'll need to become a key player in its civil war or wind up a casualty of it.
name: Letters from Lost Countries Part 3
From The Dirt, Part 2

description: Ian Baker, a 17 year-old foster kid living in New York City, is bestowed with the mystical powers of 'The Totem.' Now he must choose how to use these newfound powers, for his choice will determine whether the souls of his deceased parents go to Heaven or Hell. Not much of a choice... or is it?
name: Totem

description: Ian, our favorite teenage superhero, has to ride the line between good and evil when he has to become a member in a new gang. He also meets Xiang Mao another child of the Totem who uses his ability as an assassin. All this and a high school football coach who won't take no for an answer!
name: Young Grasshopper

description: The first cross-over in the Big City Universe has Ian fighting for his life as Vlad Tempest puts him on the menu. The Angel Michael also pays him a visit to let him know the status of Ian's mother's soul!
name: Friend or Food

description: Left on a rooftop out-cold, we find Totem dead to rights. A mysterious cult has taken interest in Ian's life - or rather, death! New enemies, football practice, gang activities and a potential girlfriend light up this issue.
name: Ties That Bind

description: Totem was plummeting towards his death! Who is Fierce, and what is his connection to Totem? Even if Totem lives, he will still have to deal with Fierce, poverty, his gang and a gambler who wants him to throw his next game!
name: Fierce Enlightenment

description: Ian has to deal with the death of another human being, believing it to be his fault! Also, the origin of Fierece and his role in Totem's future! Ian's life takes a turn for the worse in this must-read issue.

Ian confronts two members of the Totem - one that craves confrontation, the other maiming his adversaries. Learn that some attractions give way to a greater amount of pain. New villains, new problems, life and death situations. Just another day, or is it?
name: Maim & Crave

description: Vlad Tempest is a New York City Prosecutor. He's also an orphan, and a newly turned vampire. Another vampire book? Not from Big City Comics. In Vlad's world, vampires have no limitations. Garlic, holy water, the cross? All a simple ruse to allow vampires to hide in plain sight. But how can Vlad reconcile the demands of the laws he upholds as an attorney with his need to kill 24 humans each year to stay alive?
name: Tempest
